bean.p:tooltipContent: Bookmark a course to save it for future planning. The course remains in your bookmarks until you've added it to your Plan or deleted it.
Displays the last seven audits run through MyPlan. Audits are cleared at the end of each quarter.

property.name: onDocumentReadyScript

bean.p:tooltipContent: A completed quarter you registered for.

bean.p:render: @{!#parentLine.completedTerm and (#parentLine.academicRecord.size() gt 0 or !#parentLine.openForPlanning) and #parentLine.displayRegisteredHelp ? true : false}

property.name: onDocumentReadyScript

bean.p:tooltipContent: A course you have enrolled in for current or future academic quarter(s).

property.name: onDocumentReadyScript

bean.p:tooltipContent: Items in the cart are those you have selected to register for but have not been submitted for registration yet.

property.name: onDocumentReadyScript

bean.p:tooltipContent: A course you added to your plan for a specific quarter, but have not or cannot yet register for. MyPlan allows you to create an academic plan, but does not register you. Check the Time Schedule to verify that your planned courses will be offered that quarter.

property.name: onDocumentReadyScript

bean.p:tooltipContent: A course you're considering in case a planned course is not available or is full.

entry.value: @{!#line.openForPlanning ? 'The number of credits registered for a completed quarter. Check your transcript to verify completed credits.' : (#line.academicRecord.size() gt 0 ? ' The total number of credits from your planned and registered courses for the current quarter.' : 'The number of credits you plan to enroll in for future quarter.')}

property.name: onDocumentReadyScript

bean.p:tooltipContent: The total number of credits attempted for a completed quarter. Check your transcript to verify earned credits.

entry.value: The total number of credits for all course currently in the shopping cart

property.name: onDocumentReadyScript

bean.p:tooltipContent: The total number of credits for all course currently in the shopping cart.

Variable Credits
(1-5)- You can enroll for any number of credits in the range that's given. These are typically independent study courses that you and the professor decide on the number of credits.

(3/5) - A course you can enroll in for either 3 or 5 credits.

ENRL/LIMIT = section enrollment and overall enrollment limit
ENRL. RESTR. = applicable enrollment restrictions for each section
OTHER = additional information for each section
PCE = Professional & Continuing Education
